metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4611 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the LZ4 algorithm implementation, as used in YannCollet LZ4 before r118 and in the lz4_uncompress function inlib/lz4/lz4_decompress.c in the Linux kernel before 3.15.2, on 32-bitplatforms might allow context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via acrafted Literal Run that would be improperly handled by programs notcomplying with an API limitation, a different vulnerability thanCVE-2014-4715.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4611` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

liblz4-1 - 0.0~r118-1
liblz4-tool - 0.0~r118-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1013-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1013.15
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-9019-euclid - 4.4.0-9019.20
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-9019-euclid - 4.4.0-9019.20
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
lz4 package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.0~r118-1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').

linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-39.42~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').

linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
